title: Morgan 32
text:
The Morgan 32 is an American <a href="sailboat">sailboat</a> that was designed by Ted Brewer and Jack Corey and first built in 1980.
The Morgan 32 is a scaled-down development of the <a href="Morgan%2038">Morgan 38</a>.
The design was developed into the <a href="Morgan%20321">Morgan 321</a>, <a href="Morgan%20322">Morgan 322</a> and <a href="Morgan%20323">Morgan 323</a> in 1983.
Production.
The Morgan 32 was built by <a href="Morgan%20Yachts">Morgan Yachts</a> in the <a href="United%20States">United States</a> from 1980 to 1986, but it is now out of production.
Design.
The Morgan 32 is a recreational <a href="keelboat">keelboat</a>, built predominantly of <a href="fiberglass">fiberglass</a>, with wood trim. It has a <a href="masthead%20sloop">masthead sloop</a> rig with <a href="aluminum">aluminum</a> spars, a <a href="raked%20stem">raked stem</a>, a <a href="reverse%20transom">reverse transom</a>, a <a href="skeg">skeg</a>-mounted <a href="rudder">rudder</a> controlled by a <a href="Ship%27s%20wheel">wheel</a> and a fixed fin <a href="keel">keel</a>. It displaces and carries of lead ballast.
The boat has a draft of with the standard keel and with the optional shoal draft keel.
The boat is fitted with a Japanese <a href="Yanmar%202GM20">Yanmar 2GM20</a> <a href="diesel%20engine">diesel engine</a>. The fuel tank holds and the fresh water tank has a capacity of .
The <a href="Galley%20%28kitchen%29">galley</a> is located on the port side, at the bottom of the companionway stairs and features a two-burner alcohol stove and oven, a <a href="icebox">icebox</a> and a single sink with foot-pumped water. The <a href="Head%20%28watercraft%29">head</a> is located forward, just aft of the bow "V"-berth. Additional sleeping accommodation is provided by settees in the main cabin and a aft double berth. One cabin quarter berth also serves as a seat for the navigation table. The cabin trim is <a href="teak">teak</a> with <a href="ash%20%28tree%29">ash</a> striping on the ceiling.
Ventilation is provided by six opening ports, plus opening hatches in the head and bow cabin.
The <a href="mainsheet">mainsheet</a> is of a 6:1, mid-boom configuration and attaches at the bridge deck. The cockpit has two <a href="genoa%20%28sail%29">genoa</a> winches and the genoa has inboard tracks. There are also two <a href="halyard">halyard</a> winches.
Original factory optional equipment included <a href="jiffy%20reefing">jiffy reefing</a>, a bow <a href="anchor">anchor</a> roller and pressure water.
The design has a <a href="Portsmouth%20Yardstick">Portsmouth Yardstick</a> racing average handicap of 86.0.
